GYM1.Name: Leg & Glute Workout
GYM1.Title: Lower Body – Squat Focus
GYM1.Notes:
Tempo 3-1-1 = 3 seconds down – 1 second pause – 1 second up.
RPE 7–9 for hypertrophy (1–3 reps in reserve).
Brace your core as if preparing to be punched to protect your spine.

Steps.Title: Standard Warm-up (7–10 minutes)
Steps.Description:
3–5 minutes: incline walking or light cycling to raise body temperature.

2–3 minutes:
- Glute bridge: 2 × 12 reps
- Bodyweight squat: 2 × 10 reps

Ramp-up sets for the main lift:
- 1 very light set × 10–12 reps
- 1 moderate set × 5–6 reps

Steps.Title: Squat (Goblet / Back Squat)
Steps.Description:
Target muscles: quadriceps, glutes, core.

Setup:
- Feet shoulder-width or slightly wider, toes turned out 15–30°
- Weight balanced over mid-foot
- Neutral spine, chest open, eyes forward

Execution:
- Inhale deeply and brace your core
- Descend by pushing hips back while knees track over toes
- Lower until you can maintain a neutral spine (thighs parallel is a common reference)
- Drive up by pushing the floor away, keeping knees aligned

Coaching cues:
- "Sit down as if onto a chair"
- "Ribs down, core tight"
- "Knees gently out"

Breathing:
- Inhale at the top
- Maintain brace during the descent and hardest point
- Exhale near full extension

Recommended sets & reps:
- Hypertrophy: 3–5 sets × 6–12 reps (RPE 7–9)
- Strength: 4–6 sets × 3–6 reps
